  Fixes golang/oauth#269

[0m[0m[38;5;23mgithub.com/golang/oauth2[0m â€º [38;5;2mRoss Light[0m [38;5;68m"internal: remove RegisterContextClientFunc"[0m [38;5;23m(7 months ago)[0m
[38;5;239m--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[0m  internal: remove RegisterContextClientFunc

  This function added a totally unused [38;5;0m[48;5;2merror[0m path, since the only call
  site is for App Engine, which cannot produce an [38;5;0m[48;5;2merror[0m.

  Change-Id: I86277ab4ff96e7bd140c53c5a114a338716668e3
  Reviewed-on: https://go-review.googlesource.com/85935
  Reviewed-by: Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org>
[38;5;239m--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[0m[38;5;239m([0m[38;5;237mhttps://sourcegraph.com/github.com/golang/oauth2/-/commit/ee2bad97a97122079f2a3d0dce09330f085b36a0[0m[38;5;239m)
[0m[0m[38;5;23mgithub.com/golang/oauth2[0m â€º [38;5;2mRoss Light[0m [38;5;68m"internal: return error if no access_token present in server response"[0m [38;5;23m(7 months ago)[0m
[38;5;239m--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[0m  internal: return [38;5;0m[48;5;2merror[0m if no access_token present in server response

  This behavior and test was introduced in 0ae3d4edc99f765dc1513a9605aa96e82877a20a.
  It is not consistent with the other test introduced in the same commit,
  where an incorrectly typed access_token does produce an [38;5;0m[48;5;2merror[0m.  Since a
  *Token with a blank AccessToken is invalid, it is allowing an invalid
  token to be returned without [38;5;0m[48;5;2merror[0m.

  Cleans up some tests responding with invalid data.

  Change-Id: I777eb7a82ef598dc9042542ae65f8dce6768902e
  Reviewed-on: https://go-review.googlesource.com/85659
  Reviewed-by: Andrew Bonventre <andybons@golang.org>
